p: The combinatory effect of EOs and their compounds with antibiotics is a new approach that is currently being explored. Combination therapy will result in three types of effects: synergistic, additive, and antagonistic [ 105, 106]. Exploiting the synergistic combination of EO and antimicrobial agents have been suggested as one possible alternative strategy for combating antimicrobial resistance. According to a number of studies, several EO constituents have shown the ability to enhance conventional antimicrobial efficacy and potency when used in combination [ 105, 106].
